tournament.name: Wednesday 1st Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the board through countering spells, card draw, and removal, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers and creatures to stabilize the game and generate value. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for a bigger deck size and more consistency in drawing into key cards. By constantly disrupting the opponent's game plan and out-valuing them with card advantage, this deck aims to outlast and outsmart opponents in a slow and methodical manner, ultimately leading to victory through incremental advantages.

This deck focuses on control elements to slow down the opponent while ramping up mana and card advantage. By using key cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Shark Typhoon, the deck aims to control the board state and out value the opponent. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by flickering permanents for extra effects. The deck also includes removal spells like Aether Gust and board wipes like Shatter the Sky to keep the opponent's threats in check.

This deck focuses on creating a fast-paced aggressive strategy using the mono black color identity. By utilizing cards like Rotting Regisaur, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Hunted Nightmare, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total while maintaining a steady stream of threats. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion enhances the deck's ability to deal more damage with odd converted mana cost creatures. With a strong emphasis on curve efficiency and aggression, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using creatures with strong stats like Yorvo, Lord of Garenbrig and Questing Beast. It also aims to utilize mana acceleration through cards like Paradise Druid and Castle Garenbrig to quickly get out powerful threats like The Great Henge and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate. The inclusion of Gemrazer and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger provide additional removal and utility to push through the opponent's defenses. Overall, the deck aims to quickly build a wide board presence and deal heavy damage early in the game.

This deck focuses on maximizing damage output quickly by utilizing cards that sacrifice creatures for additional benefits, such as dealing direct damage to the opponent or gaining life. The inclusion of Obosh as a companion further boosts the damage potential of odd-costed creatures in the deck. By combining aggressive creatures with sacrifice synergies, this Rakdos Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and control the battlefield through efficient and relentless attacks. The key strategy is to maintain constant pressure and tempo to secure a swift victory.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game through the use of counterspells, removal, and card advantage while ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation. The deck aims to play a long game, eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon. The combination of disruption, card draw, and efficient threats makes it difficult for the opponent to establish a board presence or execute their game plan effectively. The deck also benefits from the flexibility of Expansion / Explosion for additional control or finishing potential.

The deck focuses on controlling the game with a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and board wipes while also ramping up mana and generating card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and eventually overwhelm them with powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by flickering permanents for extra triggers and benefits. The deck's strength lies in its ability to adapt to different situations and outvalue the opponent in the long game.

This deck focuses on utilizing control elements to manipulate the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and value through cards like Agent of Treachery, Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, and Elspeth Conquers Death. The deck aims to control the game through counterspells like Aether Gust and Neutralize, board wipes like Shatter the Sky, and planeswalkers like Tamiyo and Teferi. Additionally, the deck includes Yorion as a companion to provide additional value and synergy with cards like Omen of the Sea and Shark Typhoon.

Utilizing the power of Bant colors, this deck focuses on controlling the game through a variety of powerful spells and enchantments. By ramping up mana with Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, the deck aims to play powerful threats like Agent of Treachery and Shark Typhoon while countering opposing spells with Aether Gust and Neutralize. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales to provide card advantage and disruption. Elspeth Conquers Death and Omen of the Sea provide additional value and control options.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of Fires of Invention and powerful creatures like Kenrith, the Returned King and Cavalier of Flame. The deck includes a variety of removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Deafening Clarion to clear the board and maintain control. It also features card advantage engines like Sphinx of Foresight and Narset of the Ancient Way to help draw into the key pieces needed to win the game. With a mix of control elements and powerful threats, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a Standard 1 vs 1 format.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using cheap and evasive creatures like Brineborn Cutthroat, Sea-Dasher Octopus, and Brazen Borrower. The deck leverages tempo plays and counter spells like Aether Gust, Sinister Sabotage, and Mystical Dispute to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining pressure. The inclusion of cards like Stonecoil Serpent and Castle Vantress provide additional flexibility and late-game options. This deck aims to outpace the opponent and control the pace of the game to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, card draw, ramp, and powerful threats. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Thought Erasure and Agonizing Remorse, while also ramping into big threats like Cavalier of Thorns and Hydroid Krasis. The deck also includes powerful late-game cards like Casualties of War and Yorion, Sky Nomad to outvalue the opponent. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and strong threats, the deck aims to outlast and outclass the opponent in a long game.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on powerful ramp and card advantage engines to outvalue opponents. By utilizing powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, alongside versatile answers like Mystical Dispute and Casualties of War, the deck aims to control the game through its powerful card advantage and removal spells. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents for even more advantage. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue opponents through its strong control elements and ramp strategies.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various counterspells like Mystical Dispute and tempo plays with cards like Brazen Borrower. The deck aims to ramp up its mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, while utilizing cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Shark Typhoon to generate value and pressure the opponent. The inclusion of versatile cards like Expansion / Explosion and Thassa's Intervention allows for flexibility in different game scenarios. The mana base is optimized for consistency and to support the three-color Temur combination.
